intro: Erythraea linariifolia var. cymosa, commonly known as the clustered erythraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a rough texture and a distinctive grayish-green color. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
